request.description:
Creates a new **Buyer** account. E-mail should be unique (not already existing) and password should be at least 6 characters long.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: User Created (Buyer by default)

request.description:
Edits information about the user who's userID is put in the URL. This API also adds/edits data in (Custom fields)[] which have `"ReferenceTable": "Users"`.

#### Authentication
> Admin token for any userID
>
> Merchant token if userID = merchantID
>
> Buyer token if userID = buyerID

response.name: Update User Info

request.description:
Gets the information of all existing buyers/merchants/admins and owner of the marketplace.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: All users' list

request.description:
Deletes a particular user and responds with "true" is the user has been deleted.

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: User Deleted

request.description:
**Upgrades** the role of the userID specified in URL.

There are 4 roles, in ascending power:
* User - the person that buys (buyer)
* Merchant - the person that sells (seller)
* Admin - the person that controls the marketplace
* Owner - the owner of the marketplace

If you are a merchant you will be both "Merchant" and "User".
The owner can be all 4.
An admin can be "Admin" and "Merchant", or "Admin" and "User"

Values taken by {{role}}: "merchant", "Admin"

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Buyer converted to merchant

query.description: The number of results displayed
The page number
Admin, merchant, buyer

request.description:
Responds with a list of users filtered by role. 

* The admin can be a buyer and a merchant.
* All merchants can be buyers.
* That's why when not specifying the role, the total number displayed, TotalRecords, will be all the users of the marketplace. And that will be equal to the number of buyers + the admin.

Response parameters are identical to [Get All Users' Info](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#5282732e-0930-43b5-b98f-eeb3d5ce94b8)

#### Authentication
> Admin token only

response.name: Getting all merchants

request.description:
Returns the details of the addressID specified.

*Omitting the address ID returns all the addresses of the user.*

Admins can GET:
* Admin addresses
* Merchant Addresses
* Buyer Addresses

Merchants can GET:
* Merchant Addresses

Buyers can GET:
* Buyer Addresses

#### Authentication
> **Admin token**
>
> Gets addresses for:
> Admin, 
> Merchant, 
> Buyer

> **Merchant token**
> 
> Gets addresses for:
> Merchant

> **Buyer token**
>
> Gets addresses for:
> Buyer

item.description:
The addresses involved in these APIs include:
* Residential addresses
* Delivery addresses
* Pickup addresses

Different authorisations are given in those APIs.

request.description:
Adds a single item to the cart of the buyer.

**Request**

All the parameters are required.

If "CartItemType": "delivery", then you can only add:

```
"ShippingMethod": {
        "ID": "46a0896b-482f-453f-acb4-aa39ddc2707d"   (This is the ID of a shipping method that already has been created by the merchant beforehand)
    }
```
 
 **Response**
 
 The "ID" responded is represents a unique identifier for the Item in that cart. It is not the same as the Item ID given by Items API. Each item in the cart will have a unique `Cart Item ID` which is represented by the `ID` in the reponse.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

item.name: Checkout - Generate Invoice and Orders from Cart

request.description:
This API is the next step after using the [Add Item to Cart](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#ff3b5052-d889-4421-b419-942d1be7e19d) API. It generates an invoice with all the necessary data to be sent to your Payment Gateway's API. You can see the kind of data it returns in the Example Response on the right.

**Request**

The request body is just an array of the different [Cart Item IDs](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#ff3b5052-d889-4421-b419-942d1be7e19d). In the request body below, there are 3 Cart Item IDs - 3 items were checked out.

**Response**

The response will be an Invoice (for the buyer), and Order(s) for the Merchant(s). Each Order will have information that might be relevant for the payment gateway API.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

This API is for the merchant to use whenever he/she gets confirmation for the following:

"FulfilmentStatus": "Delivered" or "Acknowledged"
* Delivered: The item reached the buyer.
* Acknowledged: The item has not reached the buyer yet.

"PaymentStatus": "Acknowledged", "Processing", "Waiting For Payment", "Pending", "Paid", "Failed", "Refunded"
* This is totally dependant on the payment gateway used and the actual movement of money.

"Balance": integer
* If the merchant somehow receives money in installments, then the merchant can use this API to keep updating the balance owed to him in the Order Details.

"CartItemType": "",
"DeliveryToAddress":{
	"ID": ""
}

* If `"CartItemType": "delivery"`, then the `"DeliveryToAddress": { "ID": "" }` will take the address of the buyer.
* Make sure `"PaymentStatus"` is **not** set to `"Paid"` before updating user address.

#### Authentication
> Merchant token only

item.name: Post-Checkout - Update payments for Invoice Number

request.description:
Updates Marketplace's databases on payment details received from the payment gateway after a successful/pending/failed transaction has occured.
If `"Status"` is set as `"Success"` then "Total", "Fee", and "DateTimeCreated" and "DateTimePaid" will be  filled automatically.

This API can be used after payment confirmation is received and confirmed.

#### Authentication
> Merchant token only

**Request**


 The "ID" responded is represents a unique identifier for the Item in that cart. It is not the same as the Item ID given by Items API. Each item in the cart will have a unique `Cart Item ID` which is represented by the `ID` in the reponse.

#### Authentication

        "BuyerDescription": "The ATV aD-K18 is an 18\" electronic kick drum with a mesh head for silent play. It comes in a Black Lacquer finish and looks fantastic. The ATV kick drum works with ATV, Pearl Mimic, and Roland modules. Its a great looking kick that works well we tested one for a long time. We reommnd getting kick patch that matches your kick pedal to dramatically increase longevity. We also do not recommend using felt kick beaters on any mesh head drum as that will wear through your head much faster. Plastic or wood are recommended for beater type. \n\nKick Pedal Not Included. request.description:
The cart item `ID` can be retrieved using the `Get cart details of user` API
This API can be used with both the PUT and POST methods.
* PUT method with `"Quantity": 3`
  * Change the originial quantity of an item from `x` to `3`
* POST method with `"Quantity": 3`
  * Change the originial quantity of an item from `x` to `x + 3`

If "CartItemType": "delivery", then you can only add:

```
"ShippingMethod": {
        "ID": "46a0896b-482f-453f-acb4-aa39ddc2707d"   (This is the ID of a shipping method that already has been created by the merchant beforehand)
    }
```

If the response you receive is `null`, check the item ID you provided. If that item has child items, insert those child items' IDs instead.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

Deletes items that were added to a cart.

#### Authentication
> Buyer token only

request.description:
If you want to put data in a custom field you created, use this API to know in which reference table this custom field was assigned to.

Example:
* Reference Table: Users - Use [Update User Information](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#cce29c0d-6faa-4ad8-8a83-d6ea4baddbb6) to store data in that custom field.
* Reference Table: Implementations -  Use [Update Marketplace information](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#73471ada-ab82-42f3-bad4-af79f5e1714b) to store data in that custom field.
* Reference Table: Items - Use [Edit Item Details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#8af9bf27-a3fb-4623-b8d0-f53a67697c47) to stor datat in that custom field.

item.name: Developer - Get all Plug-in custom fields

request.description:
This API gets custom fields (CF) that are related to the plug-ins that are installed on the marketplace. However, they don't show the value stored in each individual custom field. **They also wont show custom fields that are empty.**

To know the value stored:
* If a CF has reference table "Implementations", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get Marketplace Info](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#928eac76-5bee-4bf3-9484-293551f95cde) API.
* If a CF has reference table "Users", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get User Info](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/#129fa6b1-1c39-4a41-b7b8-8aa7f2545394) API.
* If a CF has reference table "Items", then if it has a value stored in it, you'll get it by calling the [Get Item Details](https://apiv2.arcadier.com/?version=latest#a48c136d-a478-41b3-b647-66ef6c2dd440) API.

item.description: This set of API's are only usable by marketplace Admins to view, create, update and delete custom fields. Data cannot be sored into the custom fields (in the databases) using those APIs.

item.name: Emails

request.description:
This API can send emails on behalf of the marketplace Admin to anyone with a valid email address. To write the message in HTML, your whole HTML code should be in one single line, i.e, no line breaks in the JSON body. Here is a list of things you need to know before writing HTML in the "Body" parameter: * Line breaks in your email can be inserted using
* Inverted commas `href="example"` should be written as `href=\"example\"` or `style="color:#fff"` should be written `style=\"color:#fff\"` * Links should always start as `http://` or `https://`

response.name: Sending a plain text email
Send an HTML email

            "BuyerDescription": "The ATV aD-K18 is an 18\" electronic kick drum with a mesh head for silent play. It comes in a Black Lacquer finish and looks fantastic. request.description: Gets basic information about the marketplace itself. Custom Fields Names, codes, and contents can be seen by calling this API.

response.name: Marketplace Info

request.description: The only fields that can be changed are "Values" and "Names" of Custom fields. This is used to store data in "Implementation" custom fields. Admin Auth only.

response.name: Updated Custom Field Content

item.description: These 2 APIs give and update information about the marketplace itself. The most Important use of these APIs would be working with custom fields for plug ins.

request.description: Not implemented yet
Uploads photos for the userID given.

item.name: Shipping Methods

response.name: 200 OK -  no shipping method in URL
200 OK - shipping method in URL
response.body:
{
    "ID": "f3609327-e45f-450a-9be4-0705789c0c92",
    "Price": "2.50",
    "CombinedPrice": "2.50",
    "CurrencyCode": "SGD",
    "Description": "International Delivery"
}

request.description:
| Parameter           | Description                     | Type    |
|---------------------|---------------------------------|---------|
| Name                | Name of the Address - Home/Work | string  |
| Line1               | First Line of the address       | string  |
| Line2               | Second Line of the address      | string  |
| PostCode            | Postal Code                     | string  |
| Delivery            | true if address is for delivery | boolean |
| Pickup              | true if address is for pickup   | boolean |
| SpecialInstructions |                                 | string  |
| State               |                                 | string  |
| City                |                                 | string  |
| Country             |                                 | string  |
| CountryCode         | Example: SG for Singapore       | string  |

response.name: Create a shipping method
response.body:
{
    "ID": "c7946786-ccf5-43fd-8910-607f8e005a13",
    "Courier": "Arcadier Express",
    "Method": "pickup",
    "Price": "5.00",
    "CombinedPrice": "6.00",
    "CurrencyCode": "SGD",
    "Description": "Fastest in the west"
}

request.description:
| Parameter           | Description                          | Type    |
|---------------------|--------------------------------------|---------|
| ID                  | ID of the shipping address to delete | string  |
| Name                | Name of the Address - Home/Work      | string  |
| Line1               | First Line of the address            | string  |
| Line2               | Second Line of the address           | string  |
| PostCode            | Postal Code                          | string  |
| Delivery            | true if address is for delivery      | boolean |
| Pickup              | true if address is for pickup        | boolean |
| SpecialInstructions |                                      | string  |
| State               |                                      | string  |
| City                |                                      | string  |
| Country             |                                      | string  |
| CountryCode         | Example: SG for Singapore            | string  |

response.name: 200 OK - Successful Delete
response.body:
{
    "ID": "fbc03a85-ca4d-4ceb-8b15-a94487087a6a",
    "Courier": "Tanoo Ltd",
    "Method": "delivery",
    "Price": "2.00",
    "CombinedPrice": "3.00",
    "CurrencyCode": "SGD",
    "Description": "Fastest here"
}

request.description: Shipping ID is needed in the URL, not necessarily in body.

response.name: 200 OK - Succesful update
response.body:
{
    "ID": "{{shippingmethodID}}",
    "Courier": "Tanoo 4",
    "Method": "pickup",
    "Price": "10.00",
    "CombinedPrice": "20.00",
    "CurrencyCode": "SGD",
    "Description": "Fastest here"
}

item.description: These API's cannot be called without either merchant/admin authorisation. Admin can handle the shipping addresses of everyone. Merchants can only control their own addresses.

request.description: Indicates the different Fulfilment Statuses on the marketplace

response.name: Fulfilment Statuses

response.name: Get Content Pages

request.description:
"VisibleTo" take the following values:
* 0: Everyone
* 1: Merchants and Consumer only
* 2: MerchantOnly

"Available" takes the following values:
* 0: Publish
* 1: Hide

"Content" accepts HTML in a string.

item.name: Admin - Create a new payment Gateway

request.description:
Creates a new custom payment gateway on the admin dashboard. The actual API linking to the payment gateway's has to be made manually on the dashboard.
Custom Fields need to be created separately, they aren't created here.

response.name: Admin - Create a new payment Gateway

request.description: This API saves the details of the payment gateway in Arcadier's databases. It does not do the actual linking of the merchant's account to the Admin's account. The details to be filled in those parameters can be obtained from the `Merchant - Show Payment Acceptance Methods`.For clarification about how exactly to use this API, drop an email at `tanoo@arcadier.com`

response.name: Merchant - Link payment gateway

request.description: Deletes a payment gateway from the whole marketplace using its `Code`
